data:
Hi there,
As you are a year ahead of me, could I get a little help finding housing for me for this next Fall term at OSU? I tried looking at Craigslist, but I can’t tell what’s good and what’s not!
I’m on a budget, so let’s keep it under $700 a month. And no roommate! If you can, find a place that doesn’t accept cats or dogs. Please send me links to the best place or two that you find!
Thank you ever so much, 
Myrcella

Hey Myrcella, 

 

I looked around and found two places that seemed like they would be good, as I believe that they fit your criteria. Here they are:

1.       http://www.trulia.com/rental/3243753314-602-SW-2nd-St-10-Corvallis-OR-97333

2.       http://www.trulia.com/rental/3202910344-2323-NW-Monroe-Ave-Corvallis-OR-97330

 

Hope that helps,

-Charles

 

From: Baratheon, Myrcella 
Sent: Monday, September 19, 2016 9:05 AM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Housing... OMG!

 

Hi there,
As you are a year ahead of me, could I get a little help finding housing for me for this next Fall term at OSU? I tried looking at Craigslist, but I can’t tell what’s good and what’s not!
I’m on a budget, so let’s keep it under $700 a month. And no roommate! If you can, find a place that doesn’t accept cats or dogs. Please send me links to the best place or two that you find!
Thank you ever so much, 
Myrcella

I like these – they aren’t too far away from campus. Thanks for helping. I tried something called Craigslist and couldn’t tell what was good or bad!

 

Myr

-Charles

Hi there,
As you are a year ahead of me, could I get a little help finding housing for me for this next Fall term at OSU? I tried looking at Craigslist, but I can’t tell what’s good and what’s not!
I’m on a budget, so let’s keep it under $700 a month. And no roommate! If you can, find a place that doesn’t accept cats or dogs. Please send me links to the best place or two that you find!
Thank you ever so much, 
Myrcella

Hi!

 

There’s a picnic in the woods near Alsea that we’re supposed to go to this weekend. We may also hike to the waterfall. Can you please check the weather and let me know what I should wear and if I should bring sunscreen?

 

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

Hey Myrcella,

So I looked at the weather for the upcoming Friday, Saturday, and Sunday and it looks like it’s going to be mainly cloudy over the weekend so I don’t think that you’ll need sunscreen! It’s also going to be between 51 and 78 the whole weekend with a chance that it’s going to rain on Saturday, so I’d recommended bringing a raincoat as well as a jacket if you get cold easily.

 

Looking forward to it!

-Charles

 

From: Baratheon, Myrcella 
Sent: Monday, September 19, 2016 9:13 AM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Weather?

 

 

Hi!

 

There’s a picnic in the woods near Alsea that we’re supposed to go to this weekend. We may also hike to the waterfall. Can you please check the weather and let me know what I should wear and if I should bring sunscreen?

 

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

Cold and rainy… I guess I got to Corvallis too late in the “summer” :)

 

Thanks for looking this up!

 

Myr

It’s also going to be between 51 and 78 the whole weekend with a chance that it’s going to rain on Saturday, so I’d recommended bringing a raincoat as well as a jacket if you get cold easily.

 

Looking forward to it!

-Charles

Hello Charles,

 

I am planning an event at my sorority this weekend and I could use some ideas for food to make as appetizers. I am expecting to have 20 people at the event and would like to include options for those who are vegetarian or gluten free. I will have about an hour to make these ahead of time so please keep that in mind as you research. It’s really important that people love the event, so try and pick some recipes that people will rave about!

 

Please email me three or four recipes that I can consider for appetizers.  

 

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

Hey Myrcella,

So I looked around for some good appetizers that are quick and easy to make including gluten-free and vegetarian options, and this is what I came up with:

1.       http://allrecipes.com/recipe/26921/real-hummus/  - Serve with veggies instead of bread for a gluten free and vegetarian option.

2.       http://www.realsimple.com/food-recipes/browse-all-recipes/smoked-salmon-triangles - Option that is neither vegetarian nor gluten-free.

3.       http://www.realsimple.com/food-recipes/browse-all-recipes/cheese-quesadillas - Vegetarian option.

Hope this helps!

-Charles

 

From: Baratheon, Myrcella 
Sent: Monday, September 19, 2016 9:19 AM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Awesome recipes

 

 

Hello Charles,

 

I am planning an event at my sorority this weekend and I could use some ideas for food to make as appetizers. I am expecting to have 20 people at the event and would like to include options for those who are vegetarian or gluten free. I will have about an hour to make these ahead of time so please keep that in mind as you research. It’s really important that people love the event, so try and pick some recipes that people will rave about!

 

Please email me three or four recipes that I can consider for appetizers.  

 

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

These are really great, Charles! I think people here are really into salmon. The hummus and quesadillas should appeal to many. Thanks for helping me get off to a good start with my sisters! You always had good taste!

 

Myr

Hello Charles,

 

Just a friendly reminder that I’ll need the following two books soon and you promised to help me buy them for a good price! :)

 

Please find them wherever you can, just make sure you will receive them by next week for classes. My budget is at most 200 dollars to get these two textbooks, but please please please try and find the best available prices.

 

Textbooks Needed:

Engineering Economic Analysis by Donald Newnan 12th edition IBSN: 978-0199339273

 

Robert Love, Linux Kernel Development 3/e, Addison-Wesley, 2010, ISBN: 978-1-672-32946-3

 

Email me back with where to buy them for the best price so they’ll arrive next week! I owe you lunch for this big help!

 

Thanks! :) :) :)

Myrcella

Hey Myrcella, 

So I looked online for both of these books and I think that your best bets for buying them are:

1.       http://www.nylxs.com/docs/textbooks/Linux.Kernel.Development.3rd.Edition.pdf – This is a pdf of the of the Linux Kernal Development book which is available online for free immediately.

2.       https://www.amazon.com/Engineering-Economic-Analysis-Donald-Newnan/dp/0199339279 - Select the “Buy Used” option and it should cost you around 50$-70$ and you can get it shipped to you within the week.

 

Hope this helps!

-Charles

 

From: Baratheon, Myrcella 
Sent: Monday, September 19, 2016 9:30 AM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Textbook help reminder!

Thanks! :) :) :)

Myrcella

Free! I like that :) Thanks for the help. So many things for school. College is complicated!

 

Myr

Hi, Charles ,
 
Game of Thrones season six is over and I really need something new to watch! I just don’t know what would be good. 
 
I’m a big fan of action dramas such as House of Cards and Homeland (all of which I’ve already seen, unfortunately). 
 
What’s the next best show after these three? I don’t want to be fooled into watching something bad, so please see if the critics agree that the show is really excellent. Some rankings would also help give me confidence the show will be worthwhile.
 
Thank you so much! 

Melisandre

Hey Melisandre,

So I looked around for action dramas, and while I can’t say for sure which is the best, this is what I came up with: 

1.       Breaking Bad – Rotten Tomatoes: 95%, IMDB: 9.5/10

2.       Deutschland 83 – Rotten Tomatoes: 100%, IMDB: 8.2/10

3.       The Walking Dead – Rotten Tomatoes: 85%, IMDB: 8.6/10

Hope at least one of those is entertaining,

-Charles

 

From: Lannister, Melisandre [mailto:Melisandre.Lannister@oregonstate.edu] 
Sent: Monday, September 19, 2016 9:48 AM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Best TV Show to Watch

 

Hi, Charles ,

 

Game of Thrones season six is over and I really need something new to watch! I just don’t know what would be good. 

 

I’m a big fan of action dramas such as House of Cards and Homeland (all of which I’ve already seen, unfortunately). 

 

What’s the next best show after these three? I don’t want to be fooled into watching something bad, so please see if the critics agree that the show is really excellent. Some rankings would also help give me confidence the show will be worthwhile.

 

Thank you so much! 


Melisandre

Charles,

Never heard of Deutschland 83...guess I'll check that out.

Thanks!

Melisandre

	Hope at least one of those is entertaining,

	-Charles

	Hi, Charles ,

	 

	Game of Thrones season six is over and I really need something new to watch! I just don’t know what would be good. 

	 

	I’m a big fan of action dramas such as House of Cards and Homeland (all of which I’ve already seen, unfortunately).

Hi there!
 
I need to buy a gift for a friend.
 
My friend loves the outdoors and the color pink.
She’s 22 years old and her birthday is in a week (7 days).
I will need something that will get here on time.
Nothing that will take too long to ship please.
 
I have 30 dollars to spend on my friend.
Please spend as close to that as you can.
 
Please email me the link(s) to the gift(s) you find and include how much they cost.
 
Thank you,
Melisandre

Hey Melisandre,

So I looked around online for a few ideas for gifts for your friend and this is what I came up with:

1.       https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00PWY0PWM/ref=twister_B00H1LM3NI?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1 – This is a pink yoga mat, Myrcella seems to enjoy yoga quite a lot so maybe your friend can get into it too!

2.       https://www.amazon.com/Hydro-Flask-Insulated-Stainless-Standard/dp/B005LGD960/ref=sr_1_3?s=outdoor-recreation&ie=UTF8&qid=1474305162&sr=1-3&keywords=hydroflask&th=1 – This is a “pinkadelic” hydro flask which is great for camping or even just day to day use.

3.       https://www.amazon.com/Jack-Wolfskin-Velocity-Rucksack-Chili/dp/B019FIFESU/ref=sr_1_8?m=ATVPDKIKX0DER&s=outdoor-recreation&ie=UTF8&qid=1474305407&sr=1-8&refinements=p_6%3AATVPDKIKX0DER%2Cp_36%3A-3000%2Cp_72%3A1248957011 – This is a backpack for biking/running/camping so hopefully she does at least one of those, sadly it doesn’t come in pink!

 

Hope one of these works,

-Charles

 

From: Lannister, Melisandre [mailto:Melisandre.Lannister@oregonstate.edu] 
Sent: Monday, September 19, 2016 10:08 AM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Find a Gift for Someone

Thank you,

Melisandre

Charles,

I think you just coined a new word in my vocabulary - pinkadelic. We're definitely going with that hydro flask!

Thanks,

Melisandre

Hi there,
 
I heard from a friend that you are the one to talk to about this subject.
 
Unfortunately, my friend has to take two strong medications together - Adderall, and Valium. Are there any issues (contraindications) with taking them both together? Is there anything (food, activities, etc.) that he needs to avoid? I just want him to be safe. Please send a list of what you find, along with links to your resources.
 
Thanks for volunteering to check it out!
 
Davos

Davos,

I’ve looked at the interaction between valium and Adderall and there shouldn’t be any issues with taking them both together -  https://www.drugs.com/drug-interactions/adderall-with-valium-190-1645-862-441.html. While using valium he should avoid caffeine and grapefruit - https://www.drugs.com/food-interactions/diazepam,valium.html. While using Adderall he should avoid alcohol and things that cause high blood pressure - https://www.drugs.com/food-interactions/amphetamine-dextroamphetamine,adderall.html .

 

Hope this helps,

-Charles

 

 

From: Davos Stark [mailto:davos.stark@oregonstate.edu] 
Sent: Monday, September 19, 2016 11:30 AM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  check on medication

 

Hi there,

 

I heard from a friend that you are the one to talk to about this subject.

 

Unfortunately, my friend has to take two strong medications together - Adderall, and Valium. Are there any issues (contraindications) with taking them both together? Is there anything (food, activities, etc.) that he needs to avoid? I just want him to be safe. Please send a list of what you find, along with links to your resources.

 

Thanks for volunteering to check it out!

 

Davos

Charles,

Good to know, I'll let my friend know he'll be okay.

Davos

While using Adderall he should avoid alcohol and things that cause high blood pressure - https://www.drugs.com/food-interactions/amphetamine-dextroamphetamine,adderall.html .

	 

	Hope this helps,

	-Charles

	 

	 

	From: Davos Stark [mailto:davos.stark@oregonstate.edu]

Hello Charles,
 
I know graduating is coming up soon for you. It would be good to do a preliminary job search. Please find at least 1 job and send me an email with the link(s) to the job(s) you applied for. 
 
 
Here is the link for one job search site to get started. 
 
http://www.indeed.com 
 
Job criteria: 
 
You should find a computer engineering job. 
 
Must start after September 2016.
 
For now, just find one or more jobs you believe will work out well. We can talk about them further at our next meeting.
 
Sincerely, 
 
Davos

Davos,

I looked for Computer Engineering jobs in Indeed, and this is what I came up with: 

1.       http://globalcxaccenture.avature.net/opportunities/JobDetail/Nationwide-Nationwide-United-States-Java-Developer/642?source=Indeed&jobId=642

2.       http://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=9f78fa99849eee11&q=computer+engineer&l=Corvallis%2C+OR&tk=1at1s74n5b9bjcit&from=web&advn=3165350209737823&sjdu=6R86uWk5S25yjXHkFSRtfxUiBstkBZ96vfx2CQhTyLaqpe5GfMmA1hErkoXqTH3oon0DBiBFdnAvMW8_pCkqu43PAedilYtUxxIyHg16vuU&pub=4a1b367933fd867b19b072952f68dceb

They both look quite promising!

-Charles

To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Job hunting

Greetings, traveler,

 

I hear you’re are interested in exploring Eastern Europe with our group. Recently the group is wondering whether or not it is safe to travel right now. We need to do some research and see what we can find out.

 

The plan is to land in Istanbul. Next, we will be traveling to Sofia, the capital of Bulgaria.  After Sofia, the next step is some car travel to Macedonia and then onwards to Albania. Our last stop will be Tirana, in Albania.

 

The group would like to have some information sent to me to start this travel planning out:

 

A quick overview of each country’s political climate - I don’t want anyone getting into trouble and having this turn into some geopolitical affair! Is the country at war with a US ally? Is the country in political turmoil? Is there a US embassy? Is it safe to travel there now?

 

This will be a good start for the travel planning. Please research these items and send the information to me right away.

 

Kind regards,

Davos Stark

Eastern Reaches, an OSU Travel Group

Davos, 

I looked at each of the countries that the group intends to travel to, and this is what I came up with: 

Istanbul, Turkey: The US and Turkey have a fairly strong relationship and are not at war, although the US recognizes the Armenian genocide and Turkey does not, best not mention it while you’re there. 

 

Sofia, Bulgaria: Bulgaria and the US have a good relationship and there is a quite active Work-Study Program in operation between the two, so you should be fine there.

                

Macedonia: The US and Macedonia have excellent relations with them both mutually supporting each other as countries reasonably strongly, you should be good here too.

 

                Tirana, Albania: Albania has aided the US in the war on terror in the past and as such the relationship is a strong one,

 

Hope this helps, 

-Charles

Sent: Monday, September 19, 2016 11:20 AM

See you there,

Mr. Stark
